boat.name: Sheena
boat.full_description: Full history available Log 91/1, 92/1, A-W/94,S-S/95,Sep/97, Nov/97, Mar/98, Sep/98, Dec/98  Amerami Association - Contact name Jacques Chauveau.  She is easily distinguished by her very low flat hull with its distinctive square counter.  She was designed by Dyevre and built by Senocal at Los Mureaux in 1916 as a bermudan sloop believed to be to the French 8.5 metric rating, and called Lola.  Built of pine on oak frames with all her 14 cwt. ballast on the keel, she came to England in 1923 to be sailed with the Island Yacht Club on the Isle of Wight.  By 1925 she was based at Orford and had acquired her present name.  She has had many owners since, moving down the coast in the process, till she was converted to her present gaff cutter rig in 1978 by Derek Lawrence at Maldon.  She has been owned by Kevin since that time and he has established a comprehensive history of her and raced very successfully against all comers.
